articles.title: Kim Jong Il Meets Former U.S. President Bill Clinton
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Meets Former U.S. President Bill Clinton
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il today met with former U.S. President Bill Clinton and his party on a visit to the DPRK.
					Bill Clinton courteously conveyed a verbal message of U.S. President Barack Obama to Kim Jong Il.
					
					Kim Jong Il expressed thanks for this. He welcomed Clinton's visit to the DPRK and had an exhaustive conversation with him.
					
					There was a wide-ranging exchange of views on the matters of common concern.
					
					Present there were First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kang Sok Ju and Department Director of the WPK Central Committee Kim Yang Gon.

articles.title: Dinner Arranged for Bill Clinton
articles.content:
Dinner Arranged for Bill Clinton
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- The National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea gave a dinner in honor of former U.S. President Bill Clinton on a visit to the DPRK at the Paekhwawon State Guest House this evening.
					Present at the dinner was Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					Present there on invitation were former U.S. President Bill Clinton and his suite members.
					
					Present there were Chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK Choe Thae Bok, Secretary of the WPK Central Committee Kim Ki Nam, First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kang Sok Ju, Department Director of the WPK Central Committee Kim Yang Gon, Member of the NDC U Tong Chuk, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Kye Gwan and officials concerned.
					
					The dinner proceeded in a cordial atmosphere.

articles.title: Bill Clinton Arrives Here
articles.content:
Bill Clinton Arrives Here
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Bill Clinton, former president of the United States, and his party arrived here Tuesday by air.
					They were greeted by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs. 
					
					A little girl presented a bouquet to Bill Clinton.

articles.title: Congratulations to Bulgarian PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Bulgarian PM
 Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Kim Yong Il Monday sent a congratulatory message to Voiko Borisov upon his appointment as Prime Minister of Bulgaria.
					 The message wished the prime minister success in his work for the development of the country and its wellbeing.
					
					 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Rumyana Ruseva Zeleva upon her appointment as foreign minister of Bulgaria on the same day.

articles.title: Day of DPRK-China Friendship Observed
articles.content:
Day of DPRK-China Friendship Observed
 Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- An event marking the "Day of DPRK-China Friendship--Chinese Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition" took place at the Grand People's Study House Tuesday. 
					Present there were Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who is chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Hae Ryong, vice-president of the Grand People's Study House, officials in the fields of education and media and scientists and technicians.
					
					It was also attended by the delegation of the Association for Promotion of Development of Chinese Culture led by Bao Lixian, director of the Project Planning Department, the delegation of the Shanghai Association for International Friendly Contact of China headed by Vice-Chairman Lu Dilong, the delegation of the Liaoning Provincial Association for International Friendly Contact led by Standing Vice-President Hu Fengwei, the delegation of Jilin University of China led by Vice-President Li Yulin, Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Hao Xiaofei and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					Speeches were made there.
					
					Kim Hae Ryong said that the Chinese people have achieved many successes under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Hu Jintao as its general secretary.
					
					Noting that the friendly relations between the DPRK and China provided by the revolutionaries of the elder generation continue to develop favorably, he expressed the belief that these relations would grow stronger in the future, too. 
					
					Bao Lixian referred to the fact that the exchange and cooperation are brisk in all fields between China and the DPRK under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries. 
					
					He hoped that the Korean people would achieve greater successes in building a great prosperous and powerful nation while making big progress in the spirit of self-reliance and fortitude under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Hao Xiaofei expressed belief that the Sino-DPRK friendship would grow stronger thanks to the concerted efforts of the two parties, two governments and two peoples. 
					
					 The participants of the event looked round books and data on science and technology displayed by different organizations of China. 
					
					 An agreement on exchange and cooperation in the field of education between Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering and Jilin University of China was signed at the end of the event.
					
					 The Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association and the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries gave a reception at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel to mark the day.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegations
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegations
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by the delegations of the Association for Promotion of Development of Chinese Culture and the Shanghai Association for International Friendly Contact of China participating in the event of the "Day of DPRK-China Friendship--Chinese Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition".
					He also received gifts from the Liaoning Association for International Friendly Contact and the Liaoning Publishing and Media Co., Ltd, China.
					
					The gifts were conveyed to an official concerned by Bao Lixian, director of Project Planning Department who is leading the delegation of the Association for Promotion of Development of Chinese Culture, Lu Dilong, vice-chairman of the Shanghai Association for International Friendly Contact of China who is leading its delegation, and Hu Fengwei, standing vice-president of the Liaoning Association for International Friendly Contact.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the China Institutes of Contemporary International Relations.
					 The gift was handed over to an official concerned by Tao Jian, vice-president of the institutes who is heading the delegation, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Staffers of Russian Embassy Visit Chollima Steel Complex
articles.content:
Staffers of Russian Embassy Visit Chollima Steel Complex
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Alexander Matsegora, Russian charge d'affaires ad interim here, and staff members of his embassy visited the Chollima Steel Complex on Tuesday.
					Being briefed on the fact that the workers of Kangson are bringing about innovations in the production, they looked round the room devoted to the history of the complex, Steel Shop No. 1 and other places. 
					
					The charge d'affaires a. i. said the visit to the complex provided an opportunity to know well about the fighting spirit of the workers there, expressing hope that they would successfully carry out the tasks set forth by General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the future.
					
					 They handed the scrap iron secured by them to the complex.

articles.title: Reception Given
articles.content:
Reception Given
 Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- The organizing committee of the Pyongyang International Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition and the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries co-hosted a reception for the participants in the Pyongyang International Architectural Book Exhibition at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday.
					 Present there on invitation were delegations of various countries, international organizations and overseas Koreans participating in the exhibition and diplomatic envoys of various countries and staffers of foreign embassies here. 
					
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the organizing committee of the Pyongyang International Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition, and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Preservation of Juche Character and National Character Called for
articles.content:
Preservation of Juche Character and National Character Called for
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Whether the Juche character and national character are preserved or not is a key issue on which hinges the success of the revolution and construction and, at the same time, a vital issue decisive of rise or fall of the country and the nation, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed article.
					It goes on:
					
					If one does not preserve the Juche character and national character but dances to the tune of others and the West, the country and nation are bound to go to ruin.
					
					In order to preserve the Juche character and national character it is necessary to thoroughly expose and shatter all sorts of reactionary ideological trends and sophism of the imperialists and hegemonic forces and not to harbor any illusion and fear of imperialism.
					
					What is important for applying the principle of national independence is to always seek one's own method and way for advancing and developing the revolution and construction, rely on them and encourage the people to high national pride and self-esteem.
					
					It is particularly important for the parties and people building socialism. They should apply their own revolutionary style in all fabrics of the state and social life including politics, economy and culture without fail.
					
					Those countries which face social and economic difficulties and are torn off with national disputes should seek ways of settling them by their own efforts in keeping with their actual conditions and situation. They should not pin any hope on "recipe" of the imperialists.
					
					If one lacks national pride and self-esteem, one will lose the spirit of national independence. In that case one will fail to preserve the Juche character and national character and allow oneself to be subject to outside forces, in the long run.
					
					All the countries and nations should wage a dynamic struggle to check and frustrate the imperialists and hegemonic forces' moves to stamp out the Juche character and national character, bearing in mind the above-said truth about the success of the revolution and construction.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
 Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dedicates a signed article to the 12th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					The work comprehensively clarifies the tasks and ways for achieving the reunification of the country such as the issue of settling the reunification issue on the principle of national independence, the issue of achieving the great unity on the principle of placing the common interests of the nation above anything else, the issue of reunifying the country in a peaceful way, the issue of founding a reunified state of the nation based on the federal formula and the issue of improving the north-south relations. 
					
					The article says:
					
					Thanks to the publication of the work all Koreans turned out in the nationwide struggle for accomplishing the cause of independent reunification with redoubled efforts, confident of the validity and victory of the Juche-based line of reunification, without the slightest vacillation despite the anti-reunification whirlwind. As a result, they could greet the stirring June 15 era of reunification, 
					
					The situation, conditions and circumstances may change but the basic principles of national reunification laid down by President Kim Il Sung remain unchanged.
					
					The Korean nation should certainly accomplish the cause of independent reunification, holding aloft the three charters for national reunification carrying with the noble intention and instruction of the President for reunification and patriotism as a banner of certain victory. 
					
					The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration which fully embody the three charters for national reunification set forth by the President serve as great reunification programmes common to the nation and landmarks for independent reunification in the new century. In order to reunify the country peacefully on the basis of national independence and great unity and push forward the development of inter-Korean relations, it is imperative to firmly defend and thoroughly implement the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it.
					
					No matter how desperately the Lee Myung Bak group may work to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK while denying the said declarations, it can never quell the desire and will of all Koreans to achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity by their concerted efforts under the banner of the declarations.

articles.title: Colombian Study Group Responds to Appeal of Philippine Preparatory Committee
articles.content:
Colombian Study Group Responds to Appeal of Philippine Preparatory Committee
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- The Colombian Kanggye Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a statement on July 26 in support of the appeal of the Preparatory Committee of Philippines for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					The statement said that it is the duty of the followers of the Juche idea to significantly commemorate together with all the Korean people the Day of the Sun in 2012 with profound reverence for the President who led the revolution and construction on the basis of the Juche idea. 
					
					We will fully support the Korean people in their struggle to implement the last instruction for national reunification given by the President who devoted his all for the reunification of Korea, the statement noted, and added:
					
					We deem it honor to remember and glorify the great revolutionary exploits performed by the President with the Korean people. 
					
					The President rose as the sun of the 20th century, leading the Korean people to brilliant victory. 
					
					We wish the Korean people bright future and eternal happiness and the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Korean People's Important Days Marked
articles.content:
Korean People's Important Days Marked
 Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Meetings, news briefings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Britain, Switzerland and Indonesia on July 25 on the occasions of the 56th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and the 64th anniversary of liberation of Korea.    
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were photos on the immortal feats performed by the peerlessly great men and books and photos on the shining achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation.
					
					 At the events speeches were made by Harpal Brar, chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), Michael Chant, secretary of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), Keith Bennet, deputy director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, and others. 
					
					 The speakers said that the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War was a brilliant fruition of the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and the heroic struggle of the army and people of the DPRK united close around him. 
					
					 The Korean people won a victory in the three-year war, making a great contribution to the world socialism and the peace and security in Asia and other parts of the world, they said, and went on: We strongly demand the U.S. immediately pull all its forces for aggression out of south Korea and extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people firmly defending socialism. 
					
					Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said the Songun politics pursued by General Secretary Kim Jong Il serves as an all-powerful treasured sword for firmly protecting the peace and security of Korea. He declared that the committee would join the world progressive people in intensifying the movement for supporting the Korean people's just struggle.
					
					 Participants of the film shows watched such Korean films as "Korea Has Risen from the Ruins." 
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events held in Britain and Switzerland.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Human Rights Abuses Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Human Rights Abuses Censured
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Amnesty International issued a statement on July 31 chiding the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for abusing the rights of workers, according to CBS of south Korea.
					Recalling that the south Korean authorities have resorted to such despicable practices as cutting off the supply of water, food, and medicine essential for human life in a bid to suppress the strike of unionists of Ssangyong Motor Co., the statement declared such human rights abuses are intolerable.
					
					Worse still, the police used electric guns against protesters, the statement noted, adding they were little different from lethal weapons. It demanded the authorities immediately stop the human rights abuses.

articles.title: Puppet Authorities' Suppression of Jongyojo Flayed
articles.content:
Puppet Authorities' Suppression of Jongyojo Flayed
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union (Jongyojo) of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on July 31 denouncing the puppet authorities for their suppression of the organization. 
					The organization in a press release accused the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology of referring 89 leading members of Jongyojo to the prosecution on the charge that they were responsible for issuing its second declaration on the situation and threatening to have its chairman fired and all the members of its executive committee dismissed.
					
					The authorities took such disciplinary measure against them for the mere reason that they conducted the above-said legitimate movement in demand of social democracy, the press release recalled, stressing that lurking behind the action of the authorities is a sinister intention to calm down the people's discontent with their unpopular educational policy by suppressing the organization.
					
					Pointing to the evermore dynamic movement being waged by people from all walks of life to issue declarations on the situation in protest against the Lee Myung Bak regime, the press release declared the organization would carry on the struggle to the last despite any threat and violence on the part of the authorities and put an end to the fascist dictatorship.

articles.title: Meticulous Parental Care
articles.content:
Meticulous Parental Care
Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- On an autumn day of Juche 68 (1979) General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il dropped in at a railway station for a while on his way to the east coastal area.
					He was saluted by officials there. It was unexpected that he raised an issue related to the harvesting of cabbages for the winter kimchi.
					
					He stressed that coming here, he saw cabbages in fields in some cities and counties and they should reap the remaining ones as soon as possible.
					
					In those days the cabbage harvest was raised as an urgent problem as the temperature suddenly fell down in the overall parts of the country.
					
					The officials were deeply touched by the meticulous care shown by him for the dietary life of the people on his journey of pressing field guidance.
					
					His affection for the people was not confined to it.
					
					A few days later he again detrained at a station on his way of coming back from the field guidance to acquaint himself with the cabbage harvest.
					
					The meticulous care shown by the leader for winter kimchi is still conveyed as an epic of great love.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe a Bill Clinton
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe a Bill Clinton
Pyongyang, 4 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio el dia 4 al ex presidente estadounidense Bill Clinton, quien esta de visita en Corea.
					En la ocasion, el huesped norteamericano le transmitio cortesmente al Dirigente el mensaje oral del presidente de los Estados Unidos de America Barack Obama.
					
					Tras expresar el agradecimiento por el respecto, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il dio bienvenida al visitante y sostuvo sinceras conversaciones con el.
					
					 En la ocasion hubo el intercambio profundo de opiniones sobre los problemas de interes comun.
					
					 A la cita asistieron el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju y el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Yang Gon.

articles.title: CDN ofrece cena en honor de Bill Clinton
articles.content:
CDN ofrece cena en honor de Bill Clinton
 Pyongyang, 4 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Comite de Defensa Nacional (CDN) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio este martes por la noche en la Casa de Huespedes del Estado Paekhwawon una cena en honor del ex presidente estadounidense Bill Clinton de visita en Corea.
					 Estuvo presente en la recepcion el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del CDN de la RPDC.
					
					 A la ocasion fueron invitados el visitante y sus acompanantes.
					
					 Asistieron tambien el presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Choe Thae Bok, el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju, el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Yang Gon, el miembro del CDN U Tong Chuk, el vicecanciller Kim Kye Gwan y otros funcionarios interesados.
					
					 La cena transcurrio en un clima cordial.

articles.title: Bill Clinton llega a Pyongyang
articles.content:
Bill Clinton llega a Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 4 de agosto (ATCC) -- La comitiva del ex presidente de Estados Unidos Bill Clinton llego el dia 4 a esta capital por avion.
					El y su comitiva fueron acogidos por el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Yang Hyong Sop, y el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Kim Kye Gwan.
					
					Una nina entrego al visitante un ramo de flores.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun llama a mantener el espiritu Juche y la nacionalidad
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun llama a mantener el espiritu Juche y la nacionalidad
Pyongyang, 4 de agosto (ATCC) -- El mantenimiento del espiritu Juche y la nacionalidad es el problema clave y vital que decide la victoria o la derrota de la revolucion y la construccion y la prosperidad o la decadencia del pais y la nacion.
					 Imitar el modo de vida exotico, especificamente, del occidente, llevara a la ruina al pais y la nacion, adelanta el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este martes y continua:
					
					 Para mantener el espiritu Juche y la nacionalidad, es preciso revelar y frustrar totalmente la corriente ideologica reaccionaria de todo tipo y las sofisterias de los imperialistas y los dominacionistas.
					
					Ademas, no se debe hacer la ilusion ni atemorizarse del imperialismo.
					
					 Lo importante en materializar el principio de independencia nacional reside en buscar y apoyarse siempre en los metodos y remedios propios para impulsar la revolucion y la construccion y en poner mas orgulloso al pueblo de su nacionalidad.
					
					 Especialmente, los partidos y los pueblos, que construyen el socialismo, tienen que atenerse sin falta al estilo propio de caracter revolucionario y nacionalista en todas las esferas de la vida estatal y social como la politica, la economia y la cultura.
					
					 Los paises, que sufren dificultades socioeconomicas o conflictos etnicos, deberan buscar la solucion por cuenta propia y conforme a sus condiciones reales sin cifrar la esperanza en la "receta" de los imperialistas.
					
					 La falta de orgullo nacional termina en la perdida del espiritu de independencia nacional, la imposibilidad de mantener el espiritu Juche y la nacionalidad y, al fin y al cabo, en el sometimiento a las fuerzas foraneas.
					
					 Todos los paises y naciones deben luchar dinamicamente por frustrar las maniobras de los imperialistas y los dominacionistas encaminadas a suprimir el espiritu Juche y la nacionalidad.
